page.title: 05Retired Lady, Stoulton
page.content: A retired Lady lives in a Fifteenth Century cottage in the village of Stoulton. The cottage is called "Old Forge" because it was previously the smithy. Now, in her retirement she plays golf, bridge and she is very much involved in the activities concerned with preserving the beauty of the countryside. She is one of the parish council footpath representatives. There are 44 footpaths around Stoulton. She has seen many changes taking place in the countryside over the last twenty years;hedges lost and thousands of elm trees dying giving a more open appearance to the landscape. Stubble burning is strongly resented by local people because the farmers have not always kept it under control.
